Library     : nimcx.nim

Module      : cxutils.nim

Status      : stable

License     : MIT opensource

Version     : 0.9.9

ProjectStart: 2015-06-20

Latest      : 2019-03-01

OS          : Linux

Description : cxutils.nim is a collection of utility procs and templates

Imports

cxconsts, cxglobal, cxprint, cxtime, cxhash

Types

RpointInt = tuple[x, y: int]
RpointFloat = tuple[x, y: float]

Procs

proc fibi(n: int): uint64 {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

               tags: [ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect].}

pswwaux

utility bash command : ps -ww aux | sort -nk3 | tail displays output in console

    tags: [WriteIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect].}

getPassword

convenience function, prompts user for a password to be checked against a passwordhash which could come from a security database or other source 

proc cxDayOfWeek(datestr: string): string {...}{.raises: [ValueError, IOError, Exception],
                                        tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

cxDayOfWeek

returns day of week from a date in format yyyy-MM-dd

echo cxDayOfWeek(cxtoday())
echo getNextMonday("2017-07-15"),"  ",cxDayOfWeek(getNextMonday("2017-07-15"))
proc getNextMonday(adate: string): string {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception, ValueError,
    TimeParseError, Defect], tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect].}
getNextMonday
echo  getNextMonday(getDateStr())
import nimcx
# get next 10 mondays
var dw = "2015-08-10"
for x in 1 .. 10:
    dw = getNextMonday(dw)
    decho(5)
proc getRandomPointInCircle(radius: float): seq[float] {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

getRandomPointInCircle

based on answers found in

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5837572/generate-a-random-point-within-a-circle-uniformly

import nimcx
# get randompoints in a circle
var crad:float = 2.1
for x in 0..100:
    var k = getRandomPointInCircle(crad)
    assert k[0] <= crad and k[1] <= crad
    if k[0] <= crad and k[1] <= crad:
        printLnBiCol(fmtx([">25","<6",">10"],ff2(k[0])," :",ff2(k[1])))
    else:
        printLnBiCol(fmtx([">25","<6",">10"],ff2(k[0])," :",ff2(k[1])),colLeft=red,colRight=red)
proc getRandomPoint(minx: float = -500.0; maxx: float = 500.0; miny: float = -500.0;
                   maxy: float = 500.0): RpointFloat {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

getRandomPoint

generate a random x,y float point pair and return it as RpointFloat

minx min x value maxx max x value miny min y value maxy max y value

for x in 0..10:decho(5)
var n = getRandomPoint(-500.00,200.0,-100.0,300.00)
printLnBiCol(fmtx([">4",">5","",">6",">5"],"x:",$n.x,spaces(7),"y:",$n.y),spaces(7))
proc getRandomPoint(minx: int = -500; maxx: int = 500; miny: int = -500; maxy: int = 500): RpointInt {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}

getRandomPoint

generate a random x,y int point pair and return it as RpointInt

min x or y value max x or y value

for x in 0..10:
var n = getRandomPoint(-500,500,-500,200)
printLnBiCol(fmtx([">4",">5","",">6",">5"],"x:",$n.x,spaces(7),"y:",$n.y),spaces(7))
proc getPointInSphere(): auto {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

getPointInSphere

returns x,y,x coordinates for a point in sphere with max size 1,1,1

https://karthikkaranth.me/blog/generating-random-points-in-a-sphere/#better-choice-of-spherical-coordinates

# display 100 coordinates of in sphere points
for x in countup(0,99,1):
   let b = getPointinSphere()
   printLnBiCol(fmtx(["",">7","",">7","",">7"],"  x: ",b[0],"  y: ",b[1],"  z: ",b[2]))
proc randpos(): int {...}{.raises: [IOError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}

randpos

sets to a rand position in the visible terminal window

returns x position

while 1 == 1:
   for z in 1.. 50:
      print($z,randcol(),xpos = randpos())
   sleepy(0.0015)
proc showRandomCard(xpos: int = centerX()) {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
                                        tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

showRandomCard

shows a random card at xpos from the cards set in cxconstant.nim, default is centered 

proc showRuler(xpos: int = 0; xposE: int = 0; ypos: int = 0; fgr: string = white;
              bgr: BackgroundColor = bgBlack; vert: bool = false) {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

ruler

simple terminal ruler indicating dot x positions starts with position 1

horizontal --> vert = false

for vertical --> vert = true

see cxDemo and cxTest for more usage examples

# this will show a full terminal width ruler
ruler(fgr=pastelblue)
decho(3)
# this will show a specified position only
ruler(xpos =22,xposE = 55,fgr=pastelgreen)
decho(3)
# this will show a full terminal width ruler starting at a certain position
ruler(xpos = 75,fgr=pastelblue)
proc centerMark(showpos: bool = false) {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
                                    tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

centerMark

draws a red dot in the middle of the screen xpos only and also can show pos 

proc superHeader(bstring: string) {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
                                 tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

superheader

a framed header display routine

suitable for one line headers , overlong lines will

be cut to terminal window width without ceremony

proc superHeader(bstring: string; strcol: string; frmcol: string) {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

superheader

a framed header display routine

suitable for one line headers , overlong lines will

be cut to terminal window size without ceremony

the color of the string can be selected, available colors

green,red,cyan,white,yellow and for going completely bonkers the frame

can be set to clrainbow too .

import nimcx

superheader("Ok That's it for Now !",clrainbow,white)
echo()
proc newWordCJK(minwl: int = 3; maxwl: int = 10): string {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}

newWordCJK

creates a new random string consisting of n chars default = max 10

with chars from the cjk unicode set

http://unicode-table.com/en/#cjk-unified-ideographs

requires unicode

# create a string of chinese or CJK chars with length 20
echo newWordCJK(20,20)
proc newWord(minwl: int = 3; maxwl: int = 10): string {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

newWord

creates a new lower case random word with chars from Letters set

default min word length minwl = 3

default max word length maxwl = 10 

proc newWord2(minwl: int = 3; maxwl: int = 10): string {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

newWord2

creates a new lower case random word with chars from IdentChars set

default min word length minwl = 3

default max word length maxwl = 10 

proc newWord3(minwl: int = 3; maxwl: int = 10; nflag: bool = true): string {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

newWord3

creates a new lower case random word with chars from AllChars set if nflag = true

creates a new anycase word with chars from AllChars set if nflag = false

default min word length minwl = 3

default max word length maxwl = 10 

proc newHiragana(minwl: int = 3; maxwl: int = 10): string {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

newHiragana

creates a random hiragana word without meaning from the hiragana unicode set

default min word length minwl = 3

default max word length maxwl = 10 

proc newKatakana(minwl: int = 3; maxwl: int = 10): string {...}{.
    raises: [ValueError, IOError, Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

newKatakana

creates a random katakana word without meaning from the katakana unicode set

default min word length minwl = 3

default max word length maxwl = 10 

proc newText(textLen: int = 1000; textgen: string = "newWord"): string {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, Exception, ValueError], tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

newText

creates random text made up of random chars from

var. newWord procs

textgen can be one of :

newWord newWord2 newWord3 newHiragana newKatakana newWordCJK

printLn(newText(10000,"newHiragana"),rndcol)

proc rndStr(n: int = 20): string {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}

rndStr

random string with len n between 0 and hex 4DB5 

proc createRandomDataFile(filename: string = "randomdata.dat") {...}{.
    raises: [ValueError], tags: [ExecIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect].}

createRandomDataFile

this will create a file with given filename and size 1 MB filled with strong random data

createRandomDataFile("niip2.wsx") var bc = 0 var b = @[100,200,300,700,800,3000]

withFile(fs,"niip2.wsx",fmRead):
var line =""
while fs.readLine(line):
inc bc
if bc in b:
printLn($bc & rightarrow & spaces(3) & wrapwords(line.replace(" ",""),(tw - 5)),yellowgreen)

echo bc

proc drawRect(h: int = 0; w: int = 3; frhLine: string = "_"; frVLine: string = "|";
             frCol: string = darkgreen; dotCol: string = truetomato; xpos: int = 1;
             blink: bool = false; dottype: string = ".") {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

drawRect

a simple proc to draw a rectangle with corners marked with widedots. widedots are of len 4.

h height w width frhLine framechar horizontal frVLine framechar vertical frCol color of line dotCol color of corner dotCol xpos topleft start position blink true or false to blink the dots

import nimcx
clearUp(18)
curSet()
drawRect(15,24,frhLine = "+",frvLine = wideDot , frCol = randCol(),xpos = 8)
curup(12)
drawRect(9,20,frhLine = "=",frvLine = wideDot , frCol = randCol(),xpos = 10,blink = true)
curup(12)
drawRect(9,20,frhLine = "=",frvLine = wideDot , frCol = randCol(),xpos = 35,blink = true)
curup(10)
drawRect(6,14,frhLine = "~",frvLine = "$" , frCol = randCol(),xpos = 70,blink = true)
decho(5)
doFinish()

full width katakana

proc createSeqCJK(): seq[string] {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}
full cjk unicode range returned in a seq
import nimcx
var b = createSeqCJK()
var col = 0
for x in 0 ..< b.len:
   printbicol(fmtx(["<6","",""],$x," : ", b[x]))
   inc col
   if col > 10:
      col = 0
      echo()
echo()

proc boxy(w: int = 20; h: int = 5; fgr = randcol(); xpos: int = 1) {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

boxy

draws a box with width w , height h , color color at position xpos 

proc boxy2(w: int = 20; h: int = 5; fgr = randcol(); xpos: int = 1) {...}{.
    raises: [IOError, Exception], tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

boxy2

draws a box with width w , height h , color color at position xpos

similar to boxy but with random color for each element rather than each box 

proc spiralBoxy(w: int = 20; h: int = 20; xpos: int = 1) {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}
spiralBoxy 
proc spiralBoxy2(w: int = 20; h: int = 20; xpos: int = 1) {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}
spiralBoxy2 uses boxy2 
proc showSeq[T](z: seq[T]; fgr: string = truetomato; cols = 6; maxitemwidth: int = 5;
               displayflag: bool = true): string {...}{.discardable.}

showSeq

simple table routine with default 6 cols for displaying various unicode sets fgr allows color display and fgr = "rand" displays in rand color and maxwidth for displayable items this can also be used to show items of a sequence displayflag == true means to show the output displayflag == false means do not show output , but return it as a string

showSeq(createSeqCJK(),"rand")
showSeq(createSeqKatakana(),yellowgreen)
showSeq(createSeqCJK(),"rand")
showSeq(createSeqGeoshapes(),randcol())
showSeq(createSeqint(1000,10000,100000))
proc seqHighLite[T](b: seq[T]; b1: seq[T]; col: string = gold)

seqHighLite

displays the passed in seq with highlighting of subsequence

import nimcx
var b = createSeqInt(30,1,10)
seqHighLite(b,@[5])   # subseq will be highlighted if found
proc shift[T](x: var seq[T]; zz: Natural = 0): T

shift takes a seq and returns the first item, and deletes it from the seq

build in pop does the same from the other side

var a: seq[float] = @[1.5, 23.3, 3.4]
echo shift(a)
echo a
proc checkMemFull(xpos: int = 2) {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception, OSError, IOError,
                                      Exception, ValueError],
                              tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

checkMemFull

full 45 lines output of system memory status 

proc checkMem(xpos: int = 2) {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception, OSError, ValueError],
                          tags: [ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

checkMem

reads meminfo to give memory status for memtotal,memfree and memavailable maybe usefull during debugging of a function to see how memory is consumed 

proc fullgcstats(xpos: int = 2): int {...}{.discardable,
                                 raises: [IOError, Exception, ValueError],
                                 tags: [WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}
proc memCheck(stats: bool = false) {...}{.raises: [IOError, Exception, ValueError, OSError], tags: [
    WriteIOEffect, RootEffect, ReadIOEffect, TimeEffect].}

memCheck

memCheck shows memory before and after a GC_FullCollect run

set stats to true for full GC_getStatistics @[1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32]

proc distanceTo(origin: (float, float); dest: (float, float)): float {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}

distanceTo

calculates distance on the great circle using haversine formular

input is 2 tuples of (longitude,latitude)

Example

also see https://github.com/qqtop/Nim-Snippets/blob/master/geodistance.nim

import nimcx
echo "Hongkong - London"
echo distanceto((114.109497,22.396427),(-0.126236,51.500153)) , " km"
echo distanceto((114.109497,22.396427),(-0.126236,51.500153)) / 1.609345 ," miles"
decho()

for easy use in your text strings

Iterators

iterator reverseIter[T](a: openArray[T]): T
reverse iterator
let a = createseqfloat(10)
for b in reverse(a): echo b
iterator span(s: string; first: int; last: BackwardsIndex): char {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

span

iterator for strings

let s = ".something"
for c in s.span(1, ^1):
    print c
echo()

Templates

template getCard(): auto

getCard

gets a random card from the Cards seq

import nimcx
print(getCard(),randCol(),xpos = centerX())  # get card and print in random color at xpos
doFinish()
template bitCheck(a, b: untyped): bool

bitCheck

check bitsets 

template withFile(f, fn, mode, actions: untyped): untyped

withFile

easy file handling template , which is using fileStreams

f is a file handle fn is the filename mode is fmWrite,fmRead,fmReadWrite,fmAppend or fmReadWriteExisiting

Example 1

let curFile="/data5/notes.txt"    # some file
withFile(fs, curFile, fmRead):
    var line = ""
    while fs.readLine(line):
        printLn(line,yellowgreen)
